title: Data Analyst (Remote OR Hybrid)
description:
• Location: Krakow
• Department: Relativity Service Delivery
• Work Status: Full-time

Overview

Are you looking to be in a workplace where colleagues inspire one another? Are you interested in competitive and impactful benefits? Do you prefer flexible work arrangements?The Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the Service Delivery department in advanced data analysis and reporting. You will participate in projects that partner with multiple areas of the business, as well as help with goal setting and KPIs. Your strong analytical and reporting skills will allow you to report on Service Delivery metrics and make meaningful recommendations that advance the priorities and efficiency of the team. You’ll work closely with Service Delivery leaders on target setting, capacity planning, customer experience reporting, performance reporting and other data analysis projects.

Role Responsibilities
• Accountable in being the subject matter expert as it pertains to data governance for Service... Delivery.
• Create moderate to complex reporting solutions (Tableau, SalesForce) based on existing datasets
• Run, interpret and share data and performance results with stakeholders, including standardized reports on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis from various inputs (Salesforce, JIRA, telephony solution, etc.) using various outputs (Excel, PPT, Tableau).
• Surface insights and contribute to planning through accurate reporting and data analysis for our Service Delivery teams.
• Assist in the discovery work needed for Service Delivery Operations programs, including but not limited to, data collection, scrubbing and presenting.
• Report on departmental and team goals, maintain dashboards, and provide data analysis to your leader to make strong recommendations that meaningfully contribute to Relativity’s Service Delivery strategy.
• Adhere to best practices in reporting and data quality that allow the Service Delivery team to accurately report on key activities.
• Participate in business-critical operational projects that partner, collaborate, and strategize with teams inside and outside of Service Delivery.
• Run ad hoc projects as needed that are data driven, focusing on success metrics specific to teams.

Minimum Qualifications
• Experience with a SaaS or subscription-based software company.
• Intermediate knowledge of a CRM tool, preferably Salesforce.com
• Exceptional skills in Microsoft Office with an emphasis on Excel
• 1+ years experience building or enhancing dashboards within data visualization tools (eg. Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik)
• Familiarity with SQL and relational databases
• Familiarity with statistical analysis / data mining techniques and software
• Ability to analyze and document complex business processes. Apply Now

title: Data Analyst - East Europe
description:
Context:

We are driving digital transformation to enable UL to become an analytical competitor and deliver 4G growth. The Europe D&A team's vision is to transform Europe business performance and set up EU D&A as the catalyst for growth for Europe, informing outperformance decisions and initiatives to re-instate Europe as the key contributor to growth in Unilever. Our mission is to Transform the European organization to a digital-first culture, delivered by a world-class data and insights team, leaping ahead of our competition in everything we do.

The Europe D&A team is composed of data engineers, data analysts, business analysts, data scientists, and product managers, whose role is to quickly understand the business context and challenges, apply advanced mathematics and/or statistics to large data sets; and operate in cloud-based environments where data, models, and user interfaces reside in the same platforms-core technologies, to create growth choices for Europe. The scope of the... Europe team has rapidly expanded, to now cover all 38 countries in Europe and the 5 Europe business units, and the focus on D&A informing business decisions in Europe is greater than ever.

We are now creating a new Data and Analytics team in East Europe, to provide leadership in data and analytics across all East Europe region, and all 5 Business Units.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join the East Europe D&A team. This role can be based anywhere in East Europe and will report into Senior Data Analyst East Europe D&A Lead as part of our wider European D&A organization.

MAIN JOB PURPOSE:

We are looking for a Data Analyst with experience in Microsoft data modeling and visualization who can implement high-performant data analytics solutions that use our data to solve complex business issues and create value for Unilever.

Our Data & Analytics team is uniquely partnered within the business organization to ensure that we are delivering the best possible insights to help our business grow. You will be accountable for the delivery of insights from various data sources, working alongside a dynamic team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers

Main Accountabilities:
• Understand business and technical requirements to document, develop and implement analytics solutions
• Work with the Data Engineering team to ingest large amounts of data required for analysis
• Extracting and dealing with data from multiple data sources (e.g. financial systems, external data sources, marketing databases, etc.)
• Perform exploratory analysis and document findings
• Create insight reporting and data-led recommendations to the business
• Ingest, Clean, Transform and Model data following best practices and tools inc. M/Power Query and DAX
• Coding, testing, debugging and validation of deployed solutions
• Creation and visualization of PowerBI reports, dashboards, and apps including ongoing maintenance
• Leverage different statistical techniques to create insights for the business
• Hands-on delivery of solutions throughout the entire life cycle, including day-to-day management of ongoing engagements
• Ensure that deliverables meet or exceed functional, technical, and performance requirements
• Contribute to the development of your own and the business's technical acumen and skills
• Continuous learning of new tools & programming languages via external sources that bring direct value to the business
• Future Fit- Building and actively using a network of peers across Unilever Europe and Globally to both export & import best practices
Relevant experience:
• B.S. or M.S in a relevant field (Business Analytics, Operations Research), or PhD, M.S. in a relevant technical field (Operations Research, Computer Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Econometrics, or Mathematics)
• Overall experience of 1+ years preferred
• Strong analytical skills with experience in problem solving and being able to implement and deliver solutions
• Ability to rapidly connect + match analytics and data products to business needs
• Expert knowledge in the whole analytics process (business requirements, data ingestion, data modelling, and data visualisation)
• Proficient in an analysis tool such as Microsoft PowerBI (essential), and Advanced Excel
• Proficiency in M (Power Query) and DAX (essential) and Python (preferable)
• Proficiency in connecting to Microsoft Azure and publishing to PowerBI service to develop scaled analytic models in the cloud
• Ability to manage multiple requests and priorities simultaneously in a highly VUCA and competitive market
• Passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data
• Ability to apply an agile analytic approach that allows for results at varying levels of precision
• Ability to communicate complex quantitative insights in a precise, and actionable manner
Key Leadership Qualities
• Growth mind-set and a bias for action
• Ability to challenge established norms in a constructive way and drive change
• Ability to manage a large and complex set of stakeholders & hold others accountable
• Ability to make the complex and technical simple to a non-technical audience
• Experience of working effectively in cross functional, cross geography teams
Technical Skills
• Data Transformation and Cleaning Fully Operational
• Analytical Modelling and Patterns Fully Operational
• PowerBI Environment Fully Operational
• M/Power Query Fully Operational
• DAX Language Fully Operational
• Python Working Knowledge
• SQL Working Knowledge
• Data Visualisation Fully Operational
Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bring ing their 'Whole Self' to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey

title: Junior Master Data Analyst DACH
description:
As a leading global animal health company, Elanco delivers innovative products and services to improve the health of pets and farm animals around the world because we believe making animals' lives better, makes life better. Since 1954, we have provided solutions that support veterinarians, farmers and pet owners to advance our vision of Food and Companionship Enriching Life. Elanco's promise to employees: Together, we foster an inclusive culture where everyone can make a difference, encouraging ownership, growth and well-being.

This is a position that is made up of three components:

Managing customer master data for the DACH affiliate Strong communication between commercial business DACH & Elanco solution center (ESC) Constant control and improvement to our data base

The Junior Master Data Analyst DACH is supporting all customer master data activities within the affiliate. He acts as the “Go- To”- partner for all related functions that need to work with our customer master data... such as sales reps, marketing, customer service, technical service, Telesales and business insights. Especially in a market with more than 10.000 direct business customers, this role is a key to serving our customers as good as we can.

Functions, Duties, Tasks:
• Transform customer requests into MDM action: Create input/ticket to be processed or action data in ERP/ VeevaNetwork directly (direct action in case of high priority or complex cases).
• Identifying and supporting of processes improvements in customer master data
• Be direct contact person to/collaborate with Elanco Solution Center Team for MDM creation and/or change activities. Ensuring high quality execution of affiliate requests.
• Support commercial operations to maintain all fields that are within their control.
• Supporting the maintenance of Sox / Compliance.
• Projects: Support key affiliate Master Data projects in setting and developing the ERP landscape within Elanco.

Minimum Qualification (education, experience and/or training, required certifications):
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required.
• Demonstrated success in master data management, process improvements and data governance.
• Experience working in SAP S/4 HANA.
• Proven analytical/problem solving skills, capability to derive the key take aways from large data analysis.
• Fluency in German and English language.

Additional Preferences:
• Experience in Animal or related industry.
• Demonstrated project management skills, successfully handling parallel tasks and projects.
• Experiences in Veeva Network are an advantage.
• Salesforce/ CRM experience are an advantage
• Lean Six Sigma or equivalent qualifications.

We offer:
• Career at one of the leading global animal healthcare companies
• Hybrid work type
• Office located in the center of Warsaw
• Extra days off
• Open and inclusive environment which is supportive and welcoming of all diversity strands
• Sports cards (Multisport), private medical care, life insurance, Employee Referral Program

This is a fixed-term opportunity for 1 year with a possible prolongation.

Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

title: Global Data Analyst & Automation Coordinator
description:
Are you passionate about process automation and data analysis? On this position you would be a part of a Master Data team and would be responsible for Process Automation and Data Analitics supporting local and global teams.
what we offer
• private medical care
• internal and external trainings
• integration events
• sharing the costs of sports activities
• being part of an international, growing company with room for a professional development in a challenging and inspiring environment
• people – oriented company culture
• good office location - in the center of Łódź

your tasks
• support automation solutions throughout the entire lifecycle using RPA,VBA and SAP scripting
• maintain already deployed automation tools (robots, macros etc) and codes archives
• create and maintain detailed tools and process documentation
• resolve incidents within agreed SLA
• carry out process analyses that identify and define requirements of the automation potential in collaboration with the business... and local teams
• take part in assessment of automation feasibility and profitability; raise automation opportunities for discussion and implementation, if approved
• ensure automation projects are driven through all phases in required manner, including creation of tools
• drive individual projects as well as coordinate projects in the team, via creating a program plan establishingmreview meetings and good communication within the team and with stakeholders; communicate regularly on progress and share updates with management and business
• collaborate with internal teams and other departments (developers, architects and analysts) to contribute to development of automation, to ensure process continuity, effective integration of processes, as well as sharing knowledge and best practices
• develop and maintain Automation reporting – dashboard with KPIs and statistics
• steering high quality and best practices sharing within the team, prepare and conduct trainings of automation tools
• contribute to setting and keep control on following the same development standards by all team members
• prepare and analyze the Master data key performance indicators and run reports on weekly basis in accordance with agreed governance
• prepare new master data KPI’s on request and constantly seek to improve the current way of reporting KPIs and potentially setup dashboards in order to follow the development
• manage direct cooperation with Master Data Owners
• follow up on data quality issues and take the necessary actions if required
what we expect
• university degree (Bachelor or advanced degree in computer science, engineering, management information systems, data analysis or related field) is preferred
• 3+ years working experience in an automation developer / master data role
• advanced knowledge of Robotic Process Automation (RPA) platforms (e.g. Power Automate, PowerApps, etc), Visual Basic (VBA), SAP
• experience in creation of process, project and tools documentation
• work experience in collaboration across international and virtual environment
• strong technical aptitude and ability to research & solve complex issues independently
• excellent analytical skills enabling e.g. failure analysis
• a high level of self-motivation to make things happen; goal orientation
• very good planning, prioritizing and work organization skills, working in structured way
• very good level of written and spoken English
• good interpersonal skills and team spirit
• knowledge of SharePoint administration / Access / SQL language or similar code will be an asset

Employment agency entry number 47

title: Staff Data Analyst
description:
Snowflake (advanced)
BI tools (advanced)
DWH (master)
Data modeling (master)
SQL (master)

Who are GetInData | Part of Xebia? ‍ ‍

We are Big Data experts, working with international clients, creating and leading innovative projects related to the Big Data environment. We offer tailor-made solutions. It does not matter whether we are talking about building a Data Lake, conducting training in the field of data management, or performing detailed Big Data analysis. We don’t just focus on one technology, instead we specialize in a whole range of open-source and public cloud tools. Our team brings together over 140 specialists in their fields. We have participated in dozens of conferences, and written countless amounts of code, we are the organizers of Big Data Tech Summit Warsaw, the largest Polish conference related to Big Data topics. We run webinars, share knowledge on blogs, create whitepapers and more. Why? Because we believe that Big Data is an indispensable future of... business.

Thanks to that, we always select the most optimal Big Data solutions.

About role
As a Staff Data Analyst, you will play in the internal development of the GetInData approach to Data Modeling in the context of Modern Data Platforms (MDP). In the long term, you can become our Subject Matter Expert (SME) and teach other Analytics Engineer and act as a Data Modeling Expert.

Responsibilities
• Being a consultant, trainer in the team, and Subject Matter Expert in the area of Data Modeling
• Being the Leader of the Data Modeling Initiative at GetInData
• Participating in activities external to the project to better understands the field, market, or technologies
• Performing an extensive range of complex technical and professional challenges, in a variety of contexts
• Leading meetings with the client technical teams (training, handovers, requirements gathering) and internal projects
• Using your knowledge to create organizational standards
• Sharing knowledge with our GetInData community at least once a year

Requirements
• Experience in Snowflake or other cloud-managed DWH systems like BigQuery or Azure Synapse Analytics
• Knowledge of Advanced SQL and Data Modeling methodologies (Data Vault 2.0, Kimball, Inmon, etc.)
• Knowledge of at least one reporting/BI tool: Looker, MicroStrategy, PowerBI, Tableau, Click-BI
• Proficiency with DWH concepts
• Good customer-facing
• Openness to deliver training (both internal/external)
• Openness to play the role of consultant working hand in hand with our clients
• Excellent communication skills - both oral and written

We offer ‍ ‍
• 100% remote work
• Elastic working hours
• Possibility to work from the office located in the heart of Warsaw or from one of our co-working offices
• Opportunity to learn and develop with the best Big Data specialists in Poland
• International projects
• Possibility of conducting workshops and training
• Clear career path and certifications
• Co-financing sport card
• Co-financing health care
• All equipment needed for work

title: Alpha Data Operations Analyst, Associate 1
description:
Who we are looking for

The State Street’s AlphaSM Data team is seeking versatile Data Operations Analyst with data analysis skills to help us build and sustain our client’s data capabilities and competitive advantage using the Alpha services and product offerings. The successful candidate will have opportunity to obtain skills in data operations, improve communication and technical abilities. This is entry level role in Alpha Data Operations that supports clients globally and is working closely with our colleagues in Boston, Hangzhou and Bangalore.

Why this role is important to us

The team you will be joining plays an important role in the overall success of the organization. Across the globe, institutional investors rely on us to help them manage risk, respond to challenges, and drive performance and profitability. To make that happen we need teams like yours to help navigate employees and the organization as a whole. In your role you will strive for cutting-edge solutions, that... are straightforward and scalable. You will help us build resilience and execute day to day deliverables at our best.

Join us if making your mark in the financial services industry from day one is a challenge you are up for.

What you will be responsible for

As Alpha Data Operations Analyst you will
• Support data operations, make sure the data is delivered to clients on time and is of good quality. See that metrics are being produced accurately on a daily basis
• Conduct root cause analysis of data issues
• Support internal and client testing activities prior to “go live” date and immediate post-production transition with the support of test plan development and test scripts
• As part of the wider team, add an input on overall Alpha Data product enhancements and requirements
• Collaborate with Alpha Data Implementation, Service Management and IT teams to share best practices, raise issues, develop consistent global processes

What we value

These skills will help you succeed in this role
• Strong analytical and interpersonal skills
• Willingness to extend knowledge about financial markets and financial instruments.
• Attention to details, problem solving, and decision making
• Desire to learn technical skills, e.g. SQL database design, etc.
• “Can do” attitude

Education & Preferred Qualifications
• University degree in the field of finance, economics or other related field preferred.
• Up to 2 years of industry experience across Financial Services, IT or Data fields
• Good numerical and analytical abilities
• Excellent attention to detail
• Strong team ethics and team player
• Good communication and English language skills (both written and verbal)
• Basic SQL knowledge

We offer
• Permanent contract from day one
• Additional holidays (Birthday Day Off, 3rd and 5th year anniversary Day Off)
• Gold Medical Package for employees and their families (partner and children)
• Premium life insurance package and private pension plan
• Wide range of soft skills training, technical workshops, language classes and development programs
• Opportunities to volunteer your time to company-driven initiatives, employee networks or organizations of your choice
• Variety of well-being programs

About State Street

What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.

Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary in locations, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Program to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.

Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspective are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome the candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift program and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.

State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

For further information, and to apply, please visit our website via the “Apply” button below

title: Privacy Data Analyst
description:
Privacy Data Analyst - Fluent Swedish or Dutch
• Full Time
• with/without Professional Experience

We’re hiring at our location in Gdańsk
Privacy Data Analyst - Fluent Swedish or Dutch Overall Job Purpose

Job Title: Privacy Data Analyst - Fluent Swedish or Dutch

Work Type: In Office

Location: Alchemia Office

The Privacy Data Analyst is responsible for enforcing the policies for our clients products by analyzing requests under European Law Legislations from lawyers and private individuals by reviewing and processing privacy requests. You will also be responsible for handling users’ privacy requests for different workflows, following the client’s guidelines, which allow you to make sound decisions. You will have a thirst for knowledge, impeccable judgment and be comfortable operating in a fast paced, dynamic environment.
Duties & Responsibilities
• Review and process incoming privacy requests through online tools in Swedish or Dutch language and for various other markets as required... using translation tools
• Evaluate validity of each request in line with our clients policies
• Continually educate yourself about changes to policies and protocols with the support of our Training and Quality Departments
• Work closely with our clients policy specialists to address cases and regulatory inquiries using the clients response framework
• Maintain a high level of quality in each case that you review
• Achieve weekly productivity deliverables as part of daily workflow
• Effectively collaborate with team members on a range of projects to improve internal efficiency and effectiveness
• Develop skills in a number of different areas including data, tools and quality assessment
Required Qualifications & Experience
• Fluency in written and spoken Swedish or Dutch and English is essential
• Motivated by working in an environment that requires strong attention to detail
• Excellent communication skills both verbal and written
• Demonstrates ability to exercise impeccable judgment
• Ability to work in a fast paced environment with complex requests
• Ability to be flexible and adaptable to meet changing business needs
• Good computer literacy with the ability to quickly learn new tools
• B.A. or B.S. degree/masters or equivalent professional experience in online operations, privacy or legal support role desirable

Competencies
• Initiative
• Solution Orientation
• Collaboration
• Organizational Commitment
• Customer Focus
• Teamwork
• Results Orientated
• Attention to detail
• Problem Solving & Information Gathering
• Resilience & Adaptability
What we offer:

Our people are the heart-beat of our company. If you want to work in a multicultural, diverse environment with real opportunities to grow, then we’re the right choice. And, naturally, we can offer you all of the benefits of being part of a fast-growing, global business.

What we offer:
• Wellness & Engagement Activities
• Quarterly Performance Bonus
• Relocation Support
• Majorel Feel Good Program
• Career & Personal Development
• Competitive Salaries
• Paid Annual Leave
• Health Insurance
• Full Product Training
• Innovation Programs

Equal Opportunities at Majorel

Majorel is an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunities for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Majorel are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to gender, age, ethnicity, race, nationality, religion, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status or any other basis as protected by local law.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
